result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher William Melville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DOC request to clarify probation term (count two).

Order Commuting Probation Term filed and signed by the Court. The probation on count two is commuted to two years.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify probationary term on count two.

Defendant Christopher William Melville in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

COUNTS 1 AND 2 ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge if not already done.
- Pay the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served. Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  

Court ordered no DNA sample or surcharge as it has been ordered on count 1.

AS TO EACH COUNT:
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Prescott Jewelers, Catherine R., Judith W., ServiceMaster and Mark C.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges by the end of probation.  If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
on behalf of the defendant filed.

Defendant Christopher William Melville in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has complied with victim notification.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
